# elizaos/eliza Daily Update (Feb 8, 2026)
## OVERVIEW 
Today's development focused on significant advancements in authentication, plugin optimization, and agent intelligence, alongside crucial CLI bug fixes and documentation improvements.

## KEY TECHNICAL DEVELOPMENTS

### Enhanced Authentication and User Management
A major feature implemented today is the comprehensive JWT authentication and user management system. This includes support for external JWT providers and data isolation, significantly bolstering security and multi-entity support for ElizaOS. This feature required extensive changes across client, server, and core packages, including new database schemas and testing infrastructure. ([#6200](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6200))

### Plugin Optimization and Agent Intelligence
The `plugin-bootstrap` package received comprehensive optimization and robustness improvements, including performance enhancements, caching, and type safety. Additionally, a new `ActionFilterService` was introduced, utilizing vector search and BM25 reranking to dynamically filter relevant actions for the LLM, drastically reducing prompt bloat from over 200 actions to around 15. ([#6476](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6476), [#6475](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6475))

### CLI Stability and Usability Improvements
Several critical bug fixes were addressed in the CLI. This includes ensuring that `@elizaos` dependencies in new projects always use 'latest' to prevent installation failures, validating directory paths to avoid `ENOENT` errors, and enabling agent commands to load `.env` files for proper authentication with remote servers. ([#6362](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6362), [#6379](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6379), [#6376](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6376))

### Core Stability and Dependency Updates
Null checks were added to `Object.entries` calls in settings utilities within the `@elizaos/core` package to prevent runtime errors. The `plugin-bootstrap` also received a null check for `runtime.providers` to prevent `TypeError`. Furthermore, various dependencies across `cargo` and `npm_and_yarn` groups were bumped, ensuring the project stays up-to-date with the latest libraries. ([#6473](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6473), [#6471](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6471), [#6479](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6479), [#6478](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6478))

## NEWLY OPENED PULL REQUESTS
- [#6485](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6485) feat: next generation multi-language Eliza with Rust, Python and TypeScript support
- [#6484](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6484) feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management
- [#6483](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6483) docs: add environment variables documentation
- [#6482](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6482) fix(cli): validate directory path in ensureDir to prevent ENOENT error
- [#6480](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6480) fix(cli): always use 'latest' for @elizaos deps in created projects
- [#6481](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6481) fix(cli): load .env files in agent commands for authentication
- [#6477](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6477) fix: fix bootstrap cache memory leak

## CLOSED ISSUES

### CLI Authentication and Configuration Issues Resolved
The issue where `elizaos agent` commands failed when connecting to a remote server with `ELIZA_SERVER_AUTH_TOKEN` set has been resolved. This ensures smoother interaction with authenticated remote ElizaOS instances. ([#5707](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/5707))

### Improved Environment Variable Documentation
Comprehensive documentation for server environment variables, including `ELIZA_SERVER_AUTH_TOKEN`, has been added. This addresses the need for clearer guidance on configuring ElizaOS environments. ([#5716](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/5716))

## NEW ISSUES
No new issues were opened today.

## ACTIVE ISSUES
No active issues with more than 3 comments.
